channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Changes to Bukit Panjang bus services to be adjusted
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Planned changes to bus services in Bukit Panjang will be amended, after the Land Transport Authority (LTA) and MPs discussed ways to cushion the impact of these changes on commuters.

item.title: SBS Transit stays in the black on govt relief grants
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Transport operator SBS Transit posted a 27.4 per cent drop in first-half net earnings to $32.6 million as there were fewer people commuting during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Four popular wet markets see brisk business after curbs eased
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Business was brisk at four popular wet markets on the first day of entry restrictions being lifted.

item.title: 99 schools to hold ballot for Phase 2C
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Parents who were hoping to clinch a spot for their children at 99 popular primary schools in Phase 2C of the Primary 1 registration exercise will have to face a ballot.

item.title: Singapore, Japan to work on 'green lane' for essential travel
Jail for maid who pushed woman, aged 92
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

A domestic helper who pushed a 92-year-old woman on the chest, causing her to fall and hit her head, was yesterday sentenced to three years' jail for causing grievous hurt.

item.title: New infections go above 100 after recent dip
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of new Covid-19 cases here hit three digits again yesterday, after daily counts of 61 and 42 on Tuesday and Wednesday.

item.title: Latest askST@NLB talks to kick off on Aug 28 in new video format
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The latest series of askST@NLB talks kicks off on Aug 28, in a new video format but similarly tackling hot topics of the day.

item.title: One in six in dorms contracted Covid-19, based on official tally
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Experts said that if the tally is right, it would not be enough for herd immunity to develop in the migrant worker population.

item.title: Zero growth rate for cars to remain till Jan 2022
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Given the uncertainty over how travel demand patterns will evolve amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) has said it will continue with its current cap on vehicle population growth.

item.title: askST: Why are there still reports of workers in dorms being infected?
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

New infections among workers may be detected from two sources, even afterÂ the testing of all migrant workers in dormitories has been completed.

item.title: Wildlife Reserves Singapore launches animal adoption scheme
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

To share their love and support for wildlife, members of the public can now adopt animals at Wildlife Reserves Singapore (WRS).

item.title: Singapore, Japan set to resume essential travel next month
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Essential travel for expatriates and businessmen between Singapore and Japan could resume next month, as both countries agreed to ease restrictions aimed at combating the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: 45 weeks' jail for man who rented properties later used for prostitution, gambling
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

A 49-year-old man rented 21 properties under his name on behalf of other individuals, after they told him that the units would be used to house foreign students or workers.

item.title: Firms urged to take care of outsourced essential workers
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

During the circuit breaker period, cleaning company Anergy Building Services managed to keep elderly cleaners at home while ensuring their salaries would continue to be paid.

item.title: Big appetite for latest BTO flats a day after launch
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Demand is high for the Housing Board's (HDB) latest Build-To-Order (BTO) exercise, with flats in both mature and non-mature estates in Geylang and Woodlands heavily oversubscribed yesterday, just one day into their one-week launch for sale.

item.title: Judgment on bid to disbar Lee Suet Fern reserved
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's Law Society yesterday set out its arguments on why senior lawyer Lee Suet Fern should be disbarred over her handling of founding prime minister Lee Kuan Yew's will, saying she had been involved in its preparation and execution despite knowing her husband stood to gain from it.

item.title: Chilly, rainy morning follows hot August night
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

It has been a hot and wet week, just as the weatherman predicted.

item.title: President's Scholar keen to explore nation's linguistic landscape
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Alyssa Marie Loo Li Ann had President Halimah Yacob all to herself yesterday when the 19-year-old was the only one to be awarded the President's Scholarship at a virtual ceremony.

item.title: Safety lapses at bar where guard fell to his death: Coroner
item.description:
August 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The accident in which a part-time security officer fell into a 4m-deep pit to his death at 1-Altitude rooftop bar last year could have been avoided if safety standards had been observed, said the state coroner yesterday.
